### Expected stock returns dont exist.
Models Using Expected Returns
- Markowitz Model (Portfolio Optimization)
$$
max_{\omega} \quad \omega^{T}\mu - \frac{\lambda}{2}\omega^{T}\Sigma \omega \enspace \text{subject to: } \enspace \omega^{T} = 1
$$
where:
- $\mu$ is the vector of expected returns
- $\Sigma$ is the `covariance matrix`
- $\omega$ is the vector of portfolio weights
- $\lambda$ is the risk aversion parameter
